thread.title: Hollyoaks star Kieron Richardson launches Strip health cafe in Walkden - and co-stars join the party
thread.title_full: Hollyoaks star Kieron Richardson launches Strip health cafe in Walkden - and co-stars join the party

author: Dianne Bourne
title: Hollyoaks star Kieron Richardson launches Strip health cafe in Walkden - and co-stars join the party
text:
Get What's On   
Hollyoaks star Kieron Richardson has launched his own health cafe in Walkden - in a bid to get his fellow Salfordians eating lean and clean. 
Kieron has launched his Strip cafe on the main Bolton Road in Walkden with his husband Carl Hyland and business partner David Mollard, who he first met when he was a personal trainer at his gym in Worsley. 
And the team were supported at their big launch on Monday night by a host of Kieron’s Hollyoaks co-stars including Steph Waring, newcomer and Blue star Duncan James, Ashley Taylor-Dawson, Kirsty Leigh Porter, Nikki Sanderson and Ross Adams. Nikki Sanderson joins Hollyoaks co-star Kieron Richardson as he launches his new Strip health food cafe in Walkden (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
Strip opens to the public today and will be serving up healthy versions of takeaway classics like burgers and cheesy fries, as well as healthy wraps for £4.95 and “build a box” meals including proteins, healthy carbs, veg and sauces from £5.95 and a raft of freshly made smoothies. 
Becoming a healthy eating devotee himself was Kieron's motivation to launch the restaurant - after he initially started a gym regime with personal trainer David at The Marriott in Worsley. View gallery 
Kieron says: “David was great in helping me to get fit, but I was not helping myself by going to McDonald’s and eating lots of unhealthy food. 
“He helped me to realise that you have to get your nutrition right to get the results you want, and I’ll admit my motivation for starting the fitness drive was seeing all those pictures on Instagram of guys looking muscular and thinking why don’t I look like that? 
“I’d heard there were places in Manchester doing this kind of food, but for me that’s a bit of a drive into the city, as there’s nothing around here like that. 
“Monton is getting quite saturated now with restaurants and cafes so Walkden seemed like the next up and coming place, especially with the new shopping centre here.” 
And as for the name of the cafe? Kieron admits the cheeky double meaning of Strip appealed to him. He laughs: “It’s Strip as in clean eating, and stripping back to good health. And a cheeky little play on the word too!” Kieron Richardson joined by Hollyoaks stars (left to right) Kirsty Leigh Porter, Steph Waring, Jazz Franks, Jessica Fox and Duncan James as he launches Strip Health Cafe in Walkden (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
He designed all the interiors for the cafe, with the aim of “bringing the outside in” with green turf and wooden panels on the walls. 
It comes amid a busy time for Kieron, who has some explosive storylines on the way as Ste Hay on Hollyoaks, and of course he is excitedly awaiting the arrival of his baby twins with husband Carl after their IVF treatment with a surrogate mother was a success. Read More 
The twins are due in May, and Kieron will then be taking paternity leave from Hollyoaks which he says will allow him time to keep a close eye on his cafe too. Kieron Richardson and husband Carl Hyland at Strip Health Cafe in Walkden (Photo: Manchester Evening News) Read More Watch: Coronation Street star singing for patients at The Christie on Valentine's Day 
Kieron is no stranger to the catering world - although in the past it was fish and chips shops that he had invested in - so quite a change! 
He laughs: “Fish and chips will always be in my heart, but you know, you move on. We grew up with fish and chips, yes it’s brilliant and as popular as ever, but this is the new thing to jump on.” 
And we can’t help but notice that there seems to be a bit of a trend emerging for Hollyoaks stars to diversify in the restaurant world - with Ashley Taylor-Dawson launching his cocktail bar and music venue Elysium in Wilmslow, while ex-Hollyoaks star Rob Norbury is having big success in Uppermill with his Muse restaurant.
